siteData.name: Sprott School of Busness
siteData.description: Here at Sprott, future leaders gain the confidence to ask hard questions, to embrace diverse perspectives and be authentic in their leadership. For our students, alumni, faculty and staff, we are a community for life.

content.rendered:
Each student’s degree experience is unique and as such, “Degree Guides” for concentrations by year have been retired.

Plan your degree and the classes you need to take to meet your graduation goals. Use these resources for degree planning and remember to check in with your advisor on a yearly basis or if you still need help.

Undergraduate Calendar (Business Programs)

The 2021-2022 Calendar can be found at  https://calendar.carleton.ca/undergrad/undergradprograms/business/. 

For students following a previous Calendar Year, please review the Calendar Archives: https://calendar.carleton.ca/archives/.  

Contact bcom@sprott.carleton.ca or bib@sprott.carleton.ca to have your academic plans reviewed by a Sprott Program Advisor.

Fall 2021 Course Delivery Types: https://carleton.ca/registrar/registration/course-delivery-types/

Sprott Employability Passport

BCom ONLY

Students in the Employability Passport are responsible for their enrolment and progression in their Employability Passport courses (BUSI 1995, BUSI 2995, BUSI 3995, and BUSI 4995). Please make sure to confirm your current standing and register in the appropriate level courses. Please connect with the Employability Passport Coordinator if you have any questions about your progression at Employability.Passport@carleton.ca.

The successful completion of the Sprott Employability Passport courses
(BUSI 1995, BUSI 2995, BUSI 3995, and BUSI 4995) are graduation requirements for Sprott Bachelor of Commerce students admitted into first-year for Fall 2019 and beyond.

Go to Registration
